p.s: I'd like to analyse the speech from Barack Obama.
The text is structured in four sections.
In the first section, line 1-3, Obama says that he wants to build a relationship between Muslim people and the United States.
This makes clear, that he doesn't wantswant arguementsarguments between other cultures.
In the second section, line 4-12, he talks about the new spirit of activism and responsibility and that he's proud of it (l. 4).
This shows us, that Obama is proud of his country and that he loves the people there.
He makes an example where he says that he saw it in his own presidential campaign, where young people provided the energy and the idealism that made effort possible (l. 5-7).
He wants to say, that not only young people in his presidential campaign can do this.
Also other young people all over the world.
The president also says that he wants to connect young Americans to young people from all over the world to learn new languages, do an exchange or make new friends (l. 9-11).
This underlines, that you could do a lot when you are connected to people from other countryscountries.
In the third section, he says it would be nice for everyone because we can break down walls between us (l. 13-14).
This is a little bit exaggerated because he makes recruitment to make an exchange year.
With the sentence We are reminded that we are joined together by our pursuit... (l. 14-15) he says that our time to connect the world is now.
The last section he also makes recruitment that the world is, what we make of it and that we could decide what our prosperitysprosperities are (l. 18-20).
He makes clear that he would love it when we will find new friends from the United States.
The president gets the readers because of his exaggerated kind of speech.
